section.title: Welcome to CLP!
section.para: The COIN Linear Program code or CLP is an open-source simplex solver written in C++. It is primarily meant to be used as a callable library, but a basic stand-alone executable version is also available. This is the first edition of the User Guide, and is to be considered a work in progress.

This document is designed to be used in conjunction with the Samples subdirectory of the Clp directory (i.e. COIN/Clp/Samples). In the rare event that this document conflicts with the observed behavior of the source code, the comments in the header files (found in COIN/Clp/include) are the ultimate reference.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.para:
CLP is written in C++, so it is expected that a user of CLP will be writing C++ programs which use CLP. Thus a working knowledge of C++, including basic object-oriented programming terminology is assumed in this document. In addition, the user should be familiar with the fundamental concepts of
Linear Programming.
